definition: to cool off in the shade
four horse military chariot (archaic)/four (archaic)/generic term for history books
to ride/to mount/to make use of/to avail oneself of/to take advantage of/to multiply (math.)/Buddhist sect or creed

the five Liang of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Liang 前涼|前凉 (314-376), Later Liang 後涼|后凉 (386-403), Northern Liang 北涼|北凉 (398-439), Southern Liang 南涼|南凉 (397-414), Western Liang 西涼|西凉 (400-421)
lit. under a big tree the shade is plentiful (idiom)/fig. to benefit by proximity to an influential person
pinyin: da4 shu4 di3 xia4 hao3 cheng2 liang2

definition: to enjoy the benefits of the hard work of one's predecessors. (idiom)
pinyin: qian2 ren2 zai1 shu4 , hou4 ren2 cheng2 liang2

sentences.english: They are sitting in the shade of a tree.
Now, one family is sitting in front of the door to enjoy the cool, chat, full moon, eat moon cakes.
sentences.chinese: 此刻，一家人正坐在门前乘凉，聊天，望月，吃月饼。

sentences.english: This recumbent had established the acting industry company that enjoy the cool greatly, as before cannot have nothing worry about.
sentences.chinese: 这个靠着大树好乘凉的代工企业，依旧不能高枕无忧。

sentences.english: Class dismissed, the classmates all go to descend" big and green umbrella" to enjoyed cool air to go to.
sentences.chinese: 下课了，同学们都到着把“大绿伞”下乘凉去了。

sentences.english: Nine years ago on a moonlit night, my grandfather and me in the garden the cool.
sentences.chinese: 九年前的一个月夜，祖父和我在园里乘凉。

sentences.english: Many neighbors will ran to the tree shade underneath.
sentences.chinese: 许多邻居就要跑过来到大树下面乘凉。

sentences.english: He who gets close to a good tree, will have a good shade.
Did you ever enjoyed the cool air under the shade to experience the summer's tender feelings?
sentences.chinese: 你也曾经在绿荫下乘凉，体验夏天的柔情吗？

sentences.english: Chinese's three generations are "the predecessor plant trees, the posterity enjoys the cool air".
sentences.chinese: 中国人的三代是“前人栽树，后人乘凉”。

sentences.english: One generation plants the trees, another gets the shade.
It is common for families to take evening strolls and enjoy the cool night breeze.
sentences.chinese: 常有整家人在晚上到街上去溜达和乘凉。

sentences.english: Megan was resting in the tree. “And, I didn’t get hurt.
sentences.chinese: 梅金正在树下乘凉，“而且我也没受伤。

definition: to be in the sun (getting warm or sunbathing etc)/to put sth in the sun (e.g. to dry it)
to be away for the summer holidays/to spend a holiday at a summer resort/to prevent sunstroke
to rest for a bit/to take a breather
erhua variant of 打盹[da3 dun3]
to spend a summer holiday/(esp of Chinese medicine) to relieve summer heat
